message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the sale of our product with you. I think it's a fantastic opportunity for you to get your hands on a unique item. As we start our negotiation, I'd like to make an initial offer of $13500. This is a great price considering the product's value to you, and I'm confident you'll find it a fair deal.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12500. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me, and I'm willing to make a deal at this price.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your perspective, but I'm not willing to go as low as $12500. Considering the product's value to you, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm offering a revised price of $14000. This is a fair compromise that still benefits both of us.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above that price. I'm willing to pay $13000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement at this price.

I understand your persistence, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm still not willing to go as low as $13000. Considering the product's value to you, I'm willing to make another compromise. I'm offering a revised price of $13750. This is a fair price that still reflects the product's value, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement at this price.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not willing to go above $13000. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $13500. This is the highest price I'm willing to pay for the product.
